oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Military Pass
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate pass allowing a wagon to return home after being used for military service. The reverse side is an order from Col. George H. Nixon for a soldier to return to duty or be considered a deserter. Nixon served as Colonel of the 48th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. Capt. Henry Evans of Co. I, 48th Tenn. Inf. Regt. (Nixon's), CSA signed both sides of this pass. Evans later commanded the regiment after it was consolidaed with Voorhies 48th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA.
